message.content:
cs.CR, cs.DB, cs.LG, cs.DS, cs.IT 

This paper discusses privacy mechanisms for protecting sensitive information in data collections, which is a common topic in computer security (cs.CR) and databases (cs.DB). The paper also proposes a variant of local differential privacy (LDP), which involves adding geometric noise to individual records, making it relevant to machine learning (cs.LG) and data structures (cs.DS). Finally, the paper discusses the statistical utility of the proposed mechanism, which is related to information theory (cs.IT).
